Summary: Good basic coffee for your Keurig
text:
This is pretty good coffee at a very reasonable price compared with other Keurig coffees. I liken it more to Dunkin coffee than Starbucks. The pods work fine even though as others have pointed out, they are not true K Cups. They come in 3 x 12-pod bags, and they stay fresh until you open the bag. You can reseal the bag with tape, or transfer the pods to a ziplock bag. I happened to have an OXO coffee storing container that keeps them fresh after they are taken out of their plastic bag.

Give 'em a try, they're not half bad, and it sure beats paying $15 for 24 K Cups.
